responses.rationale: Reports counts ('at least 26 states') and duration ('nearly a year') using standard language.
Reports numerical corrections ('to 22 million', 'to 13 million instead of 18 million') using standard language.
Reports numerical corrections ('at 22 million', 'to 13 million instead of 18 million') using standard language.
Reports a numerical finding ('one in five milk samples') using standard language.
Reports statistical data ('56 percent') using standard language ('reported', 'were fatal').
Describes a mechanism of spread, not primarily reporting numerical data or metrics.
Reports numerical data ('23 states') using standard language ('shows', 'have confirmed cases').
Reports numerical data ('35,500 birds') using standard language ('confirmed').
Reports locations of cases, not primarily reporting numerical data or metrics.
Reports numerical data ('about 11.7 million turkeys') using standard language ('raises').
Reports numerical data ('46 million chickens') using standard language ('had').
Reports numerical data ('about 13 million chickens and 305,000 turkeys') using standard language.
Reports numerical data ('about 22 million birds', '1.8 million', '1.9 million', '1.9 million') using standard language.
Reports numerical data ('two more farms', '5.3 million hens and 88,000 turkeys') using standard language.
